Good Afternoon,

This message is to keep our students, parents, and fans informed of our football game situation for next week.

Our Tri-Valley varsity football team was scheduled to play Pine Ridge next week, September 4th. Pine Ridge has decided not to play varsity football this year. Since we received that information, we have been working to schedule another game for our football team. We have pursued teams from both the local area and as far away as Hot Springs. So far, we have been unsuccessful in finding any teams that have an open date for next week that are willing and/or able to play.

If another (11-man) team should have to cancel their game for next week, we will do what we can to schedule their opponent. But, as of right now there is no game for the Mustangs football team on September 4th.

Have a great weekend.

Kindergarten Screening and Registration 2020

Tri-Valley Elementary
January 6 at 8:57 AM ·

Please share with families that have a child(ren) this age....

KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION AND SCREENING
Friday, March 13, 2020
Tri-Valley kindergarten registration and screening will be held Friday, March 13, 2020, from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. If you have a child who will be 5 years old on or before Sept. 1, 2020, please either call the school or sign up online by selecting the sign-up button below:

Please bring the following along to registration:
A CERTIFIED COPY of your child’s birth certificate
His/her Social Security card
Proof of residency, which may include 2 of the following:
Utility Bill
Rent Receipt
Phone Bill
Homeowner/Renter’s insurance policy

A copy of your child’s immunizations must be turned in to the school nurse prior to the 1st day of school.

There will be NO SCHOOL for current JrK and Kindergarten students on Friday, March 13th. All other grades will still be in session. Please mark your calendars and make alternative plans for your Kindergarten student on March 13th.

Greetings,

On June 11th, registered voters of the Tri-Valley School District will have the opportunity to vote either “Yes” or “No” on a school bond issuance. The purpose of this bond election is for a K-4 elementary school in Crooks and for facilities improvements at our existing location.

Our school board will be hosting three informational town hall meetings to go over this information and answer questions from patrons. All three meetings will start at 6:30 p.m.

Tuesday, May 7th – Taopi Hall in Colton. (6:30p.m.)
Thursday, May 16th- Crooks Community Center (6:30 p.m.)
Monday, May 20th- Avera Hall located at the University Center (6:30p.m.)

All members of the public are invited to attend.

Respectfully,

Dr. Mike Lodmel, Superintendent

At the April meeting, the Tri-Valley School Board passed a resolution calling for a special bond election for the purpose of a new elementary school and facility improvements at the existing site. This election will take place on June 11, 2019.

I’m sure there will be a lot of questions on what this all means and what this all entails. We will be holding several “town halls” to inform our patrons of all the facility building information as well as giving patrons an opportunity to ask questions. These “town hall” dates have not been set as of yet, but I would anticipate them taking place throughout the month of May.

We will be releasing the dates and locations of the “town hall” meetings as soon as they are set.

Respectfully,

Dr. Mike Lodmel, Superintendent

Greetings,

This morning our administration team met with our transportation director and reviewed the current weather forecast. Currently, the wind is predicted to increase up to 40 mph this afternoon. With albeit an uncertain, but large potential, for freezing rain throughout the afternoon our busses would be beyond our comfort level for safety with the slick roads and high winds.

Therefore, Tri-Valley will be releasing today at noon. High school students will be released at 11:20 for lunch and dismissed after lunch. All students will have the opportunity for lunch before dismissal. Again, Tri-Valley is dismissing today at noon due to the high winds and freezing rain predicted in the forecast.

Tri-Valley Kindergarten registration and screening will be held Friday, March 22, 2019 from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. If you have a child who will be 5 years old on or before September 1st, 2019, please either call the school at 605-446-3538 to sign up!

Please bring the following to registration:

*Certified copy of your child's birth certificate
*Your child's social security card
*2 proofs of residency. This may include: utility bill, rent receipt, phone bill, or home/renter insurance policy

A copy of your child's immunization must be turned into the school nurse prior to the 1st day of school.
